alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued December 14 at 3:02PM AKST until December 16 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills to 55 below expected. The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin. * WHERE...Along the Yukon River near Eagle. * WHEN...Noon Wednesday to noon Thursday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southeast winds gusting to 25 mph down the Yukon River Wednesday afternoon through Thursday morning will cause very cold wind chills. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
